conbody.p: Individual cloud and cluster services that are paired are best described as enabled and disabled. This is because one service is actively responding to requests while the other service is not. The disabled service acts as a hot-spare in event that the enabled service fails. A cloud administrator views service state information using the euca-describe-services command.
These are the five possible states for services in the cloud. The normal operational states in Eucalyptus HA are ENABLED and DISABLED.
